verses.text_plain: The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.
verses.verse_html: 1The transgression of the wicked saith within my heart, that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

verses.text_plain: For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful.
verses.verse_html:
2For he flattereth himself in his own eyes, until his iniquity be found to be hateful. ▼
▼ until…: Heb. to find his iniquity to hate

footnotes.body_text: ▼ until…: Heb. to find his iniquity to hate
footnotes.body_html: ▼ until…: Heb. to find his iniquity to hate

verses.text_plain: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, and to do good.
verses.verse_html: 3The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit: he hath left off to be wise, and to do good.

verses.text_plain: He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.
verses.verse_html:
4He deviseth mischief upon his bed; he setteth himself in a way that is not good; he abhorreth not evil. ▼
▼ mischief: or, vanity

verses.text_plain: Thy mercy, O Lord, is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.
verses.verse_html: 5Thy mercy, O Lord, is in the heavens; and thy faithfulness reacheth unto the clouds.

verses.text_plain: Thy righteousness is like the great mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: O Lord, thou preservest man and beast.
verses.verse_html:
6Thy righteousness is like the great mountains; thy judgments are a great deep: O Lord, thou preservest man and beast. ▼
▼ the…: Heb. the mountains of God

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the…: Heb. the mountains of God
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the…: Heb. the mountains of God

verses.text_plain: How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.
verses.verse_html:
7How excellent is thy lovingkindness, O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of thy wings. ▼
▼ excellent: Heb. precious

verses.text_plain: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures.
verses.verse_html:
8They shall be abundantly satisfied with the fatness of thy house; and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thy pleasures. ▼
▼ abundantly…: Heb. watered

tokens.text: and thou shalt make them drink

verses.text_plain: For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.
verses.verse_html: 9For with thee is the fountain of life: in thy light shall we see light.

verses.text_plain: O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart.
verses.verse_html:
10O continue thy lovingkindness unto them that know thee; and thy righteousness to the upright in heart. ▼
▼ continue: Heb. draw out at length

footnotes.body_text: ▼ continue: Heb. draw out at length
footnotes.body_html: ▼ continue: Heb. draw out at length

verses.text_plain: Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.
verses.verse_html: 11Let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand of the wicked remove me.

tokens.text: against me, and let not the hand

verses.text_plain: There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
verses.verse_html: 12There are the workers of iniquity fallen: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
